TopicTitle: Dirty pleasure of breaking the rules:-)

Articles.Content:
I wonder about the condition of the human spirit. I've noticed that people from an early age like to break the established rules or prohibitions.

For example, drivers who exceed the speed limit, which, moreover, extremely stupid and irresponsible because they endanger not only their lives but also other road users, but not wanting to write about it.

I recently read that the "defenders of morality" are sounding the alarm, because the kids are able to get around parental control systems. I personally do not have any kids, and probably never will have them, I do have Asperger instead

But perhaps if I were a parent or guardian of the minor would be probably pissed off that kid went around parental control system which I have set. On the other hand, some kind of defiance and resourcefulness is admirable.

The world would be terribly boring if it was filled with the bunch of yes man without own opinion.

Ergo some kind of defiance is good for humans spirit, especially if want someday to reach star
Except on the forum. Don't break rules here. That is all.
Or else I'll eat you!!

Or else I'll eat you!!
Or Vanamonde will .
Perhaps Vexx will chop off our heads with his flute-sword

http://0.tqn.com/d/coins/1/0/U/H/-/-/US0050-Washington-Quarter-Example-Unc-obv.jpg

Yeah. This isn't a google picture war, so be careful with how much you push the limits.
i view most rules and laws as guidelines. some make sense, others are asinine.

Usually, following the rules is a good thing to do. There's a reason they are there . Most rules make sense if you give them some thought.

If I can't find a reason that a rule is there (whether or not I agree with it), I haven't thought about it enough.
I always get nervous when I see the "Notifications" panel lit up. I don't want to break the rules, I really don't...

Usually, following the rules is a good thing to do. There's a reason they are there . Most rules make sense if you give them some thought.

If I can't find a reason that a rule is there (whether or not I agree with it), I haven't thought about it enough.

http://www.dumblaws.com

Have fun...

Edited May 2, 2014 by vger

don't confuse statutes with morality, there is no connection

only common law is based on morality.

statutes are a legal trick that only apply to corporations, but because of people's lack of knowledge in the law and the corruption of legal establishments they are applied to citizens as a source of income for the private courts.

Edited May 2, 2014 by MartGonzo

I recently read that the "defenders of morality" are sounding the alarm, because the kids are able to get around parental control systems.

...

But perhaps if I were a parent or guardian of the minor would be probably pissed off that kid went around parental control system which I have set. On the other hand, some kind of defiance and resourcefulness is admirable.

Remember the good old days when parents let TV be a babysitter? It's not so different today.

Remember the good old days when parents let TV be a babysitter? It's not so different today.

Remember the good old days when one adult could make enough to feed a spouse and two kids, and the only time parents needed a babysitter was for some alone-time?
